intro: Seseli trichocarpum, commonly known as the woolly seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in meadows and along roadsides. Seseli trichocarpum is known for its hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive, rugged appearance.
